dry out.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to become completely dry or to make something completely dry, especially after it has been very wet
dry out.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: In summer, water the plants regularly and never let the soil dry out.
The kitchen was flooded and it took ages to dry it out.
dry out.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to stop drinking alcohol after you have become an alcoholic, or to make someone do this
dry out.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: He’s been drying out at a private clinic.
The hospital dried Michael out and sent him home.
